title: Maude's Problem
description: Maude is distraught when she finds out that Carol is seeing a psychiatrist and decides to confront the man she's convinced is wrecking her home.

title: Doctor, Doctor
description: Maude clashes with Arthur over sexual liberation and hang-ups after her grandson Phillip is found playing doctor with Arthur's granddaughter.

title: Maude Meets Florida
description: Obsessed with hiring a black housekeeper so she can "liberate" her, Maude meets her match in Florida Evans of "Good Times" fame.

title: Like Mother, Like Daughter
description: Maude is upset when Carol begins dating a man from her past 40 years Carol's senior.

title: Maude and the Radical
description: Maude throws a party and invites black militants and rich white liberals. She does not tell anyone it is a fund raiser party.

title: The Ticket
description: After Maude fails to argue her way out of a speeding ticket, she proceeds to traffic court to plead her case and ignores Arthur's attempts to fix it behind the scenes.

title: Love and Marriage
description: Tired of being single, Carol agrees to marry a man she doesn't love much to Maude's chagrin.

title: Flashback
description: The early returns of the 1972 presidential election find Maude and Walter reminiscing to four years earlier when they were first dating.

title: Maude's Dilemma: Part 1
description: Maude must make a difficult decision when she finds out she's pregnant at 47.

title: Maude's Dilemma: Part 2
description: Conclusion. Convinced Walter wants to be a father, Maude decides to go ahead and have the baby.

title: Maude's Reunion
description: Maude welcomes her old college friend for a visit but is stricken with regret when she sees how successful the friend has become.

title: The Grass Story
description: Maude and her friends are determined to get arrested in protest after a 17 year-old kid is arrested for possession of marijuana.

title: The Slumlord
description: Walter and Maude purchase an apartment building for an investment. The residents being to picket in front of the Findley house, calling Walter and Maude slumlords.

title: The Convention
description: During a trip to attend Walter's convention, Maude tells Walter she is discouraged about finding a job and thinks it is because she is a woman Maude decides to speak about woman's lib at Walter's convention.

title: Walter's 50th Birthday
description: Maude throws a party for Walter's 50th birthday. As expected, he is not happy about turning 50, thinking he has not achieved anything.

title: Maude and the Medical Profession
description: As Maude and Walter are about to go to Italy, she has a rash. Arthur prescribes some medicine but she has a bad reaction to it.

title: Arthur Moves In
description: Arthur is staying with the Findlay's, but he is overstaying his welcome.

title: Florida's Problem
description: Florida arrives at Maude's in a bad mood. She tells Maude that her husband wants her to quit her job, but she does not want to.

title: Walter's Secret
description: Carol sees Walter in a restaurant with a beautiful woman. Carol tells Maude that Walter might be having an affair and Maude gets upset.

title: Maude's Good Deed
description: Maude tries to play matchmaker with Arthur and a good friend, Jane. Maude finds out Jane has problems with her daughter, Linda, and she tries to reconcile them.

title: The Perfect Marriage
description: Maude and Walter think they have a perfect marriage until they start picking it apart and comparing themselves to others.

title: Maude's Night Out
description: Walter is not looking forward to going to a party because the host flirts with Maude. Maude is flattered by the attention she gets, until Walter tells her the man is already involved in an extramarital affair.

title: Walter's Problem: Part 1
description: The day after a party, Walter wakes up with a drunken headache. Since it seems Walter drinks a lot at parties and most evenings, he and Maude decide to stop drinking altogether. Walter finds it difficult to stop.

title: Walter's Problem: Part 2
description: Walter gives Maude a black eye when he is drunk. More than ever, Maude wants him to stop drinking. Arthur gets a recovered alcoholic to talk to Walter. Maude gets rid of all the liquor in the house.

title: Walter's Holiday
description: Walter wakes up in a great mood and declares it I Love You Day. He plans to take the day off from work so he can spend a romantic day with Maude. However, Vivian comes to visit and is depressed now that she is divorced.

title: Maude's Facelift: Part 1
description: Vivian returns from a five-week trip to forget her problems after a divorce. She calls to say she is coming by and has a surprise. It is a surprise - she had a face lift and looks years younger. Now Maude is upset because she looks older.

title: Maude's Facelift: Part 2
description: Since Vivian returned from a trip with a face life, now Maude wants one. She goes to Boston to have it done.

title: Florida's Affair
description: The furnace repair man that Maude hires has more interest in Florida than in fixing the furnace. He sweeps Florida in his arms for an impromptu dance in the kitchen when Henry walks in.

title: Maude Takes a Job
description: Walter does not like it when Maude takes a job in real estate.

title: The Double Standard
description: Maude says that couples should be able to live together without being married. But then Carol returns home after a camping trip and expects her boyfriend to stay over.

title: Vivian's Problem
description: Vivian is tired of all the blind dates that Maude sets up for her. She says she is giving up on men.

title: Maude's Musical
description: Maude is in charge of organizing a benefit show to raise money for the library. Since it is a tribute to burlesque, she wants all the bumps and grinds to jazz up the show.

title: The Will
description: Maude and Walter get into an argument over writing their wills and the items each list.

title: Carol's Problem
description: Carol is engaged Chris and everyone is looking forward to the wedding. Since Maude is in real estate, she decides to put a down payment on a house for them as a gift. The house is across the street from Maude and Walter.

title: Music Hath Charms
description: Maude gives Walter an electric organ as an anniversary gift. Unfortunately, he plays it all the time and has no musical talent.

title: The Office Party
description: It's Christmas and Walter decides to throw his employees a party at the house. Walter is so happy at how tight knit he and his people are, not unlike another business that's shut down because of a union strike. But during the party Maude learns that his people have decided to join a union and Maude thinks it's great. When Walter learns of this, he feels betrayed. He decides to fire them.

title: The Love Birds
description: Maude & Walter invite Vivian and Arthur over for dinner, but Maude is not looking forward to the lovebirds cooing over each other. They arrive, but arguing. Arthur constantly talks about his dead wife.

title: Maude's Guest
description: Maude is excited about boarding a young girl from the Ghetto over the summer. She hopes to show the teenager all the wonderful things that are available. However, the teenager is sullen because she does not want to be there.

title: The Wallet
description: Maude finds a wallet and it turns out to be their neighbor who always has extramarital affairs. Maude returns it to the man's wife. Walter thinks it is wrong to give it to the wife instead of the man because a wallet is personal property.

title: Maude's Revolt
description: Maude is depressed on her birthday, and is surprised by the party Walter throws for her. All Maude wants is for Walter to stay with her instead of going to talk with the men. Walter forgets his promise and Maude leaves her own party.

title: The Commuter Station
description: Arthur and Vivian are getting married, and Maude convinces them to have their wedding in Vermont. They all make the train trip, but a blizzard interrupts the trip and causes tempers to flair.

title: Florida's Goodbye
description: Maude notices Florida has been acting strange lately. She finds out Florida has been trying to find a way to tell Maude she is quitting. Since Florida's husband got a promotion, Florida decided she was going to be a stay-at-home housewife.

title: The Tax Audit
description: Walter is being audited by the tax department. When the auditor appears, Walter is worried and nervous, but Maude realizes the man looks familiar. She finally realizes he is the man that had raped her over thirty years before.

title: The Investment
description: Arthur gives Walter a stock tip which turns out to be a bad tip, causing Walter to lose a lot of money. When he finds out that Arthur did not invest any of his own money, Walter and Arthur argue as well as Maude and Vivian.

title: Phillip's Problem
description: Carol and Chris plan a trip without Phillip. Carol is hesitant because Phillip has been causing problems at home recently. They go on vacation and Phillip gets worse. Maude realizes something has to be done.

title: The Runaway
description: Francie's boyfriend talks her into visiting Maude and asking for a lot of money. She puts on a good act about being tired, upset, and having problems. Francie and Hinkley plan to run away.

title: Maude Meets the Duke
description: Arthur has been sending fan letters to John Wayne for years. When John Wayne visits the town to film a movie, for publicity he has a scheduled stop at Arthur's home. But the roof caves in, and the event is held at Maude's place.

title: The Kiss
description: Walter is upset and feeling unloved because of work pressure and things at home. Vivian is upset because Arthur does not like her dog. They turn to each other for comfort and a kiss. Maude and Arthur see it.

title: Walter's Heart Attack
description: Walter tries to help his bookkeeper not commit suicide and suffers a mild heart attack at her apartment. At the hospital, he tries to hide the fact he was at a woman's apartment from Maude.

title: The New Housekeeper
description: Since Florida has left, Maude hires a new maid, sight unseen. At first, she seems like a dream, but then she caters only to Walter since he is the master of the house. Maude corrects her.

title: Speed Trap
description: When Walter and Arthur go on a camping trip, they get stopped for speeding by a cop who is only too happy to throw them in jail for not paying the ticket.

title: Lovers in Common
description: Maude brags to Vivian that an old boyfriend still finds her attractive when she receives a card from him. It becomes a competition for his supposed affection when Vivian also gets a card from the same old boyfriend.

title: Walter's Dream
description: When Walter and Arthur return from a Canadian fishing trip, Walter tells Maude he wants to move to Canada. He puts his appliance store up for sale. Maude is determined not to move.

title: A Night to Remember
description: Both Maude and Walter have their own problems to deal with, causing them to have restless nights. Maude is facing a hysterectomy and Walter has problems at his store.

title: Last Tango in Tuckahoe
description: Maude and Walter find a naked man in the maid's closet.

title: Vivian's Party
description: Arthur tells Vivian at the last minute that he is bringing twelve people home for dinner. Frantic, Vivian asks Maude and Mrs. Naugatuck to help her. Everything prepared, Maude and Walter go to the party and find they are not invited.

title: Maude the Boss
description: Maude gets promoted to Office Manager at her work. One man that reports to her does not take her seriously and tries to sabotage Maude's work.

title: Maude's New Friend
description: Maude's new male friend is gay, and Maude thinks she is being very liberal in understanding him. She learns a few truths about herself.

title: Walter's Ex
description: Walter and Maude are delighted to hear that Walter's ex-wife is getting married which means he can stop alimony parents. When they find out the intended groom is Maude's rich uncle, they realize she is only marrying Henry for his money.

title: Nostalgia Party
description: Walter & Maude host a costume New Year's Eve Party where everyone has to show up in clothing that represents the year they think was the best. Everyone has a different idea of what year was the best as the costumes vary greatly.

title: All Psyched Out
description: A famed psychic reads Maude's fortune and alerts her to some surprising events that will occur in the near future, one of them being that she will marry for a fifth time. Maude begins to worry about this possibility when the psychic's other predictions start coming true. Ultimately, Maude decides the best thing to do is to remarry Walter; however, he throws a fit when she suggests a double ring ceremony.

title: The Telethon
description: Maude and the gang come together to perform in a telethon that Maude has organized. However, when she fails to come up with a celebrity to appear in the telethon she is left organizing a telethon without a cause, when the charity for which Maude has put in a lot of work withdraws at the last moment. As the minutes wind down, she must come up with a cause or face being taken off the air.

title: And Then There Were None
description: When Carol returns home one morning and announces that she is engaged, Maude is ecstatic until she discovers the future groom is already married.

title: The Emergence of Vivian
description: When Maude recruits Vivian into women's liberation, Arthur is not pleased that Vivian is ignoring her "household duties," and when she tries to stand up for herself, Arthur refuses to listen, putting their marriage in a delicate position.

title: Mrs. Naugatuck in Love
description: While Maude, Vivian and Carol are planning a bridal shower for Mrs. Nagatuck, she gets devastating news that the wedding has been called off.

title: Walter's Pride
description: When Walter's business is in $12,000 debt and is facing bankruptcy, Maude suggests that she mortgage the house to get the funds, but a stubborn Walter won't let her, so she does anyway and ask Arthur to say the money came from him.

title: Walter Gets Religion
description: When Walter suddenly becomes passionate about religion and drags Maude to church services. Maude is less than thrilled with attending and can hardly stay awake. She becomes even more irate when she learns the reason for Walter's sudden conversion.

title: The Cabin
description: When Vivian and Arthur get into a sudden romantic mood which leads to Arthur inviting Vivian away on a romantic weekend to a cabin, Maude becomes unsure of her marriage with Walter. Trying to put the spark back in her marriage, Maude plans a romantic weekend but the situation turns out to be less than ideal.

title: Maude's Mother
description: Maude is a bundle of nerves with her mother's upcoming visit to meet Walter for the first time. Her insecurities come out when her mother arrives, just as Walter's first tv commercials hit the air and aren't as respectable as Maude hoped.

title: The Split
description: When Maude shows up late for a awards dinner for Walter, he forces her to choose between her run for a position on the New York State Senate or him.

title: Consenting Adults
description: When Maude becomes overwhelmed with grief about Walter moving out into his new apartment, she changes her mind about breaking up and wants to get back together until she gets an eyeful of his new swinging singles apartment.

title: Rumpus in the Rumpus Room
description: When Walter shows up at a party with a much younger escort, Maude gets angry and they argue which causes Walter to fall off the wagon and start drinking again.

title: Maude's Big Decision
description: When Maude decides to pull herself out of the election to help Walter with his alcoholism, he discovers he is being selfish and decides he wants her to continue her run for office.

title: The Election
description: It is finally election day, and Maude is happy that her marriage is back on track and that her and Walter have reconciled. However, she's nervous that she may not win the election, especially when she appears on a television talk show and voices her liberal views toward premarital sex. Suddenly Maude realizes she may lose the election.

title: Viv's Dog
description: When Vivian and Arthur go out of town on a vacation, Vivian leaves her dog, Chuck in Maude's care. However, when Chuck unexpectedly passes away, Maude must break the news to Vivian but fears Vivian will blame her for Chuck's death.

title: For the Love of Bert
description: When Maude finds a piece of paper that Mrs. Naugatuck dropped with an address on it, she becomes determined to discover what Mrs. Naugatuck is up to.

title: The Fling
description: While having dinner at a restaurant with Maude, Vivian sees her ex-husband who has been enjoying the swinging single life.

title: Maude Bares Her Soul
description: When Maude has a session with a psychiatrist, she pours out all her innermost feelings, revealing her anxieties ranging from her feelings for her dead father, her resentment towards her mother and her fear of turning 50.

title: Arthur's Medical Convention
description: While accompanying Arthur on a trip to Pittsburgh to attend a medical convention, Walter poses as a doctor as a joke at the conference, but he is called for a real emergency when a handyman begins to have a heart attack in the hotel room.

title: Arthur Gets a Partner
description: Vivian returns from a relaxing retreat; Arthur invests in flashlight slippers.

title: Walter's Ethics
description: When Randolph Cutler is on the verge of a major business deal with Walter's store, Walter uses his secretary to make sure he agrees to the deal.

title: Poor Albert
description: Maude receives a letter from her ex-husband Albert, who believes he's on death's doorstep, and he arrives on Maude's doorstep with a final request of her. Meanwhile, Founders Day has Walter advertising in the local newspaper and gearing up for a big sale.

title: The Christmas Party
description: With Christmas on the way, Walter has his annual office Christmas party at the house. But he's worried that Maude's feminist friend, Stephanie, who goes out of her way to preach to everyone on women's rights, will put a damper on the festivities. Maude must step in and find the middle ground between standing up for women and free spirited frivolity of some of the party-goers.

title: The Case of the Broken Punch Bowl
description: Maude attempts to find out who broke her antique punch bowl.

title: Walter's Stigma
description: Maude is excited for Walter's birthday, and has planned a surprise party for him. The party is interrupted by two police officers who arrest Walter for indecent exposure earlier that day. When Walter's alibi proves nearly as embarrassing than the accusation, it's up to Maude to get the charges dropped, while simultaneously convincing the editor of the Tuckahoe Tribune to cancel their front-page story on Walter's arrest.

title: Maude's Mood: Part 1
description: Maude becomes obsessed with getting Henry Fonda elected president. Shocked by her behavior, Walter and Carol question her mental stability and later learn that she is manic depressive.

title: Maude's Mood: Part 2
description: Maude becomes obsessed with getting Henry Fonda elected president. Shocked by her behavior, Walter and Carol question her mental stability and later learn that she is manic depressive.

title: Tuckahoe Bicentennial
description: Maude stages a tribute to American women for the Tuckahoe Bicentennial celebration and all the men are convinced it is a money losing proposition. After seeing some of the practice performances, the man who owns the studio pulls out. However, it seems that all the men were wrong, and soon the show is sold out.

title: Mrs. Naugatuck's Citizenship
description: Mrs. Naugatuck has been studying to take the exam to become a United States citizen. However, the day before the examination, she begins to forget even the simplest facts about United States history, and is quickly diagnosed as having suffered a minor stroke. Now hospitalized, her chances of becoming a citizen are in jeopardy.

title: Maude's Nephew
description: Maude's nephew visits and everything about him annoys Walter.

title: Maude's Rejection
description: Maude is ecstatic when she discovers that Vivian is having a literary authority over for lunch. Maude had previously met him at a cocktail party and is dying to spend time with him. However, she is stunned and unable to come to terms with the fact that he cannot stand her.

title: Carol's Promotion
description: Carol is determined to get a big promotion at work.

title: Maude's Ex-Convict
description: While Mrs. Naugatuck is on vacation Maude hires an former convict to do the housework.

title: Vivian's First Funeral
description: Vivian's friend has died, but she does not want to go to the funeral. She has never been to a funeral before.

title: Maude and Chester
description: Maude and her ex-husband meet to clear up some legal issues and end up being locked in the lawyers office at the end of the day.

title: Bert Moves In
description: Mrs. Naugatuck's boyfriend proposes marriage, but when he loses his job, he un-proposes. He has to move in with Mrs Naugatuck to save money.

title: Walter's Crisis: Part 1
description: Maude & Walter have a planned vacation, but when Walter does not get a loan, their plans are put on hold.

title: Walter's Crisis: Part 2
description: Since Walter's loan fell through, he finds himself unemployed and out of money. He is depressed and nothing seems to help him.

title: Walter's Crisis: Part 3
description: Walter's depression of his loss of money and work continues. Since he is unable to sleep, he takes a sleeping pill, but then swallows more pills than necessary for sleep.

title: The Election
description: Election day is approaching and Carol goes to the percent to help out. Maude finally gets a chance to meet Carol's new boyfriend, and she finds out he is ten years younger than Carol.

title: The Game Show
description: Maude & Walter, Vivian & Arthur visit New York. Maude and Vivian visit a game show recording and are chosen to be contestants.

title: Arthur's Worry
description: Walter wakes up from a bad dream and is hesitant to tell Maude. He dreamed that he kissed Arthur. Walter now dreads the upcoming camping trip with Arthur.

title: Mrs. Naugatuck's Wedding
description: Mrs. Naugatuck is getting married but she refuses to change her last name to her husband's last name. While Maude and Carol support her decision, the men are not so understanding.

title: Maude's New Friends
description: Maude and Walter meet new friends through Vivian and Arthur. The new friends seem to like Maude & Walter more. It turns out they are into wife swapping and do not think Vivian and Arthur are the right partners.

title: The Rip-Off
description: Maude stays home when the others go out to see a movie. When Walter, Vivian, and Arthur return, they walk into the house to find Walter & Maude's home was burglarized and Maude is tied up. Walter goes to extremes to find security.

title: Walter's Christmas Gift
description: With Maude and Walter's finances low, they make homemade gifts to give others for Christmas gifts. Arthur offers Walter a partnership in a new business.

title: Captain Hero
description: Maude's cousin is visiting at the same time that Maude is trying to find contributors for her mental health clinic. The cousin insults one of the potential contributors.

title: Maude's Adult Relationship
description: Walter does not mind that Maude has a luncheon with her handsome work associate, but Arthur keeps telling him he should worry.

title: Arthur's Crisis
description: Maude & Walter are having a dinner party with some friends. Walter's friend Albie is a fun-loving prankster who irritates Maude but makes Walter laugh. When Albie dies during an operation, Walter no longer feels safe.

title: Maude's Desperate Hours
description: While Walter is out of town, Maude gets threatening phone calls saying someone is going to kill her. She thinks it is a painter who has been hired to work on the house.

title: Maude's Reunion
description: While attending her 30th class reunion, Maude is shocked to find one of her dearest school friends has suffered a debilitating stroke.

title: Feminine Fulfillment
description: Maude is shocked when she finds out that Vivian joined a woman's group that promotes women to cater to their husband's needs.

title: Maude's Aunt
description: Maude's aunt visits, and she can be just as caustic as Maude.

title: Arthur's New Best Friend
description: Maude thinks that Walter & Arthur must have had a disagreement since Walter is hanging out with another friend, and not doing anything with Arthur. Turns out it is because Arthur has a new friend who is a snob.

title: Vivian's Surprise
description: Vivian is happy and relaxed after Arthur comes back from a trip. Vivian explains that Arthur is a different man, and then wonders what might have happened while he was out of town to cause his change of heart.

title: The Household Feud
description: Mrs Naugatuck has a party but does not invite Maude & Walter. When Maude accidentally breaks Mrs Naugatuck's urn, Mrs Naugatuck thinks it is revenge for not being invited to the party. Then Mrs Naugatuck purposely breaks an item of Maude's.

title: The New Maid
description: While riding home on the subway one evening, Maude strikes up a friendship with a young West Indian woman. However, Maude discovers her wallet is missing after she leaves. Maude thinks the woman did it. The jokes on her when she discovers the woman is a new maid.

title: Maude's Guilt Trip
description: Maude dreads the arrival of her Aunt Tinkie who is flying in to visit. The last thing Tinkie said was she got a $50,000 flight insurance policy naming Maude as beneficiary. News reports that the plane crashed. Maude plans a trip to Rome.

title: Phillip and Sam
description: While Carol is off on a weekend with her boyfriend, Phillip says he wants to spend the night with Sam. Turns out, Sam is the short name for Samantha.

title: The Flying Saucer
description: Maude insists she saw a flying saucer.

title: Victoria's Boyfriend
description: Victoria's Jamaican father is in America and visits Victoria. When he finds out his daughter is dating an American, he is upset.

title: Walter's Temptation
description: Maude goes on a talk show to promote womanhood. Afterwards, she convinces Walter to give his assistant a raise. His assistant is appreciative and tries to show her pleasure to Walter.

title: Phillip's Birthday Party
description: Maude throws a birthday party for Phillip, but Walter places a lot of rules for the attendees. The party is easy until a bunch of older teens crash the party.

title: The Doctor's Strike
description: Arthur organizes a doctor's strike and everyone promises not to practice medicine. Walter gets sick and needs a doctor.

title: The Ecologist
description: Maude is working with an ecologist on cleaning the Hudson River. Walter is jealous since the guy is young and attractive. Maude has sexual fantasies about the ecologist.

title: The Gay Bar
description: Arthur does not like having a gay bar in town.

title: Businessperson of the Year
description: Maude was a major player in getting a mall in the town which means she is eligible for Businesperson of the year. But Walter is also eligible. Both Maude & Walter openly compete for the award.

title: Maude's Christmas Surprise
description: Victoria is unhappy because she is away from her family for the first time during a holiday, and Maude thinks it will be a sad one because everyone has other plans. Maude then finds a baby left on her doorstep and everyone's outlook changes.

title: Maude's New Client
description: Maude is excited that she might have a real estate client who is interested in purchasing an expensive home. She is not excited when she finds out her client is connected to the mob.

title: The Obscene Phone Call
description: Maude has her telephone number changed because she has been receiving obscene phone calls. When the caller starts calling with the new numbers, she starts to suspect she might know the person.

title: Musical '78
description: Baby Sally is a former child tap dancer who became disabled in her adult years. Maude holds a musical fund raiser to raise money for her care.

title: My Husband, the Hero
description: When Maude, Walter, and Vivian are out for dinner, the restaurant catches on fire. Walter moves Maude out of the way so he can save another restaurant customer. Maude is none too pleased when Walter is declared a here.

title: Maude's Foster Child
description: Maude's Ethiopian foster child for 20 years visits Maude and Walter for the first time. As she get to gets to know the grown man, she finds out he is the child of a former dictator.

title: Vivian's Decision
description: Vivian considers leaving Arthur after attending a college reunion and finding out that many of her former classmates and current college students are working and making a difference in the world. She tells Arthur she wants things to change.

title: Carol's Dilemma
description: Carol's ex husband has started seeing Phillip more, and is sending flowers to Carol. Carol starts wondering if he is interested in her again. However, Vernon is getting remarried to someone else and wants custody of Phillip.

title: Arthur's Grandson
description: Arthur's grandson is visiting, and Arthur hopes to heal the problems with his son by befriending the grandson.

title: Mr. Butterfield's Return
description: Victoria is on a camping trip for the weekend with her boyfriend at the time her father show up to visit her. He is not happy to learn that his daughter is sleeping with someone, and he says he is going to take her back to the West Indies.

title: Phillip's Mature Romance
description: Maude is happy to tell Carol that Phillip is in love with a new girlfriend. Then Maude finds out the new girlfriend is four years older than Phillip.

title: Maude's Big Move: Part 1
description: Maude's friend Irene returns from China; Maude has a party to welcome her back. But the party is not joyous. Walter is closing his business, planning to retire. The Harmon's and Carol & Phillip are planning to move. Worse, Irene collapses.

title: Maude's Big Move: Part 2
description: Maude's friend Irene, a US Congresswoman, has died, Maude feels bereft. She's also sad, knowing Arthur, Vivian, Carol & Phillip are moving. Maude decides to run for the open position caused by Irene's death, and ends up appointed instead.

title: Maude's Big Move: Part 3
description: Maude & Walter move to Washington, DC, where Maude starts her new career as Congresswoman. Maude has disagreements with her new staff, and at home, finds a pushy maid.
